intro: Subularia monticola, commonly known as the mountain starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Subularia monticola is notable for its adaptability to cold climates and its role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions.
